option.name: description
option.value:
Reports properties ending with [space]… instead of ….
See punctuation guidelines.

option.name: problemDescriptor
option.value: Property has an extra space before the ellipsis

replaceConfiguration.name: "var = volatile = E" should be "volatile = var = E"

constraint.name: field
constraint.script:
"import com.intellij.psi.PsiField import com.intellij.psi.PsiModifier import com.intellij.psi.PsiReferenceExpression import com.intellij.psi.PsiVariable
field instanceof PsiReferenceExpression && ((PsiReferenceExpression)field).resolve() instanceof PsiField && ((PsiField)((PsiReferenceExpression)field).resolve()).hasModifierProperty(PsiModifier.VOLATILE) && var instanceof PsiReferenceExpression && ((PsiReferenceExpression)var).resolve() instanceof PsiVariable && !((PsiVariable)((PsiReferenceExpression)var).resolve()).hasModifierProperty(PsiModifier.VOLATILE)"

replaceConfiguration.name: 'suspendCoroutine' lacks cancellation guarantees
replaceConfiguration.description: 'suspendCoroutine' does not react on cancellation of the context 'Job', which may result in infinite suspension of the enclosing coroutine. It is better to use 'suspendCancellableCoroutine' if the intention is to work in the structured concurrency area.

searchConfiguration.name: @CoroutinesTimeout is discouraged
searchConfiguration.description: '@CoroutinesTimeout' results in installation of 'DebugProbes' from kotlinx.coroutines. In IntelliJ Platform, we install 'DebugProbes' ourselves, so the default way should be avoided

searchConfiguration.name: @HardwareAgentRequired should be applied only for performance tests
@HardwareAgentRequired should be applied only for performance tests

replaceConfiguration.name: @ScheduledForRemoval with version
replaceConfiguration.description: Report usages of @ScheduledForRemoval annotation which specify 'inVersion' attribute.
replaceConfiguration.problemDescriptor: We don't specify target version in @ScheduledForRemoval annotation anymore.

searchConfiguration.name: Alarm creation can be expensive
searchConfiguration.description: Alarm registration in Disposer is expensive, please use AppExecutorUtil.getAppScheduledExecutorService().schedule() or EdtScheduledExecutionService instead

searchConfiguration.name: Anonymous Disposable passed to method
searchConfiguration.description: Do not pass Disposer.newDisposable() or similar to method expecting Disposable, because it can cause memory leak via Disposer tree. Instead, pass Disposable which you can guarantee to be disposed at the time needed.
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Anonymous Disposable passed to method: possible memory leak

Anonymous threads are discouraged; please supply name

Avoid usage of Optional in Kotlin
Avoid usage of Stream API in Kotlin
searchConfiguration.description: Usage of Java Stream API should be converted to Kotlin sequences or collection extensions, with exception of Stream usage for parallel processing.

searchConfiguration.name: Avoid usage of Stream API in Kotlin

replaceConfiguration.name: Call to 'equals()' on KaType
replaceConfiguration.description: Calling `equals` on two types only checks whether the structure of the types is equal, not whether the types are actually equal.

replaceConfiguration.name: can use ArrayUtil
replaceConfiguration.description: emptyCollection.toArray() creates new array whereas ArrayUtil.toArray() methods don't similarly, ArrayUtil.EMPTY_*_ARRAY don't allocate

constraint.name: __context__
constraint.script:
"import com.intellij.psi.* import com.intellij.psi.search.GlobalSearchScope import com.intellij.psi.util.PsiUtil
def ccf = JavaPsiFacade.getInstance(__context__.getProject()).findClass("com.intellij.concurrency.ConcurrentCollectionFactory", GlobalSearchScope.allScope(__context__.getProject())); def ccfVirtualFile = PsiUtil.getVirtualFile(ccf);
ccfVirtualFile != null && __context__.getResolveScope().contains(ccfVirtualFile)
"

constraint.name: __context__
constraint.script:
"import com.intellij.psi.* import com.intellij.psi.search.GlobalSearchScope import com.intellij.psi.util.PsiUtil
def stringUtil = JavaPsiFacade.getInstance(e.getProject()).findClass("com.intellij.openapi.util.text.StringUtil", GlobalSearchScope.allScope(e.getProject())); def strVirtualFile = PsiUtil.getVirtualFile(stringUtil);
e instanceof PsiLiteralExpression && e.getParent().getParent().getParent() instanceof PsiIfStatement && ((PsiIfStatement)e.getParent().getParent().getParent()).getElseBranch() == null && strVirtualFile != null && e.getResolveScope().contains(strVirtualFile)
"

searchConfiguration.description: Whether two types are equal depends on the context

CompletableFuture methods using default executor
searchConfiguration.description: If executor isn't specified explicitly, ForkJoinPool is used, which doesn't support the propagation of IntelliJ platform's thread context (e.g. modality state or remote development client id). Pass some platform executor as an additional method parameter or wrap the passed task in 'captureThreadContext'.
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Platform's thread context (modality state, rem-dev client id, etc) is lost when the default executor (ForkJoinPool) is used. Pass some platform executor as an additional method parameter or wrap the passed task in 'captureThreadContext'.

Don't use javax.swing.FocusManager
searchConfiguration.description: javax.swing.FocusManager is obsolete, using it can cause default application's focus traversal policy to be changed. javax.swing.KeyboardFocusManager should be used instead.

Don't use serializer(type)
searchConfiguration.description: Use Class.serizlizer(), it's faster

searchConfiguration.name: Double ' in without { in property value
searchConfiguration.description: A double single quote in a propery value without a parameter like {0} will be rendered as a doubled single quote in the result. When a parameter is present it will be rendered as a single single quote.

replaceConfiguration.name: Empty ResolveState usage
replaceConfiguration.description: ResolveState#initial is an empty state that does not contain any data valuable for reference resolution such as GoPsiImplUtil#CONTEXT or GoPsiImplUtil#CURRENT_ELEMENT. Use GoPsiImplUtil#createContextOnElement or GoPsiImplUtil#withContextOnElement with a proper substitution context instead.

EventLogGroup version should be > 0

replaceConfiguration.name: Graphics clipping region should be updated not replaced
replaceConfiguration.description: setClip is a dangerous method that can break rendering of Swing components. It ignores the current clipping region and allows painting outside of the component. This method can be used in some specific cases, one of them is to restore the previous clip. In other cases, you have to use Graphics.clipRect or Graphics2D.clip.

searchConfiguration.name: Logger should be a top-level declaration
searchConfiguration.description: Creating a logger for each instance of a class isn't optimized. The idiomatic way to create a logger is using a top-level declaration.

replaceConfiguration.name: Manual TextRange.substring() implementation
replaceConfiguration.description: Reports code pattern like str.substring(range.getStartOffset(), range.getEndOffset()). This code could be replaced with range.substring(str)

searchConfiguration.name: Method reference can slow down startup
searchConfiguration.description: Method references in class initializers cause qualifier class to be loaded as well, even if that reference would never be invoked

Presentation text copying will lose mnemonic

replaceConfiguration.description: Presentation.getText() omits assigned action mnemonic. Consider using presentation.setTextWithMnemonic(getTemplatePresentation().getTextWithPossibleMnemonic()) instead.

replaceConfiguration.name: Problem highlight type override
replaceConfiguration.description:
Inspections have their severity and highlight types specified in inspection settings. Having any other options than ProblemHighlightType#GENERIC_ERROR_OR_WARNING will override the user-defined highlighting.

In cases when multiple severity levels are expected, consider one of the following options:

  1. Implementing a separate inspection. You should always prefer separating inspections so that a user can control them individually, as suggested by JetBrains design guideline
  2. Extracting an intention, if the severity level is INFORMATION.
  3. Implementing an anemic inspection implementing PairedUnfairLocalInspectionTool or UnfairLocalInspectionTool. That way, the inspection may act as a settings holder for the severity levels.
  4. Implementing a custom settings panel for your inspection.

To fix this problem properly, it might be important to verify that the plugin.xml contains a valid level and editorAttributes parameters.

Also avoid registering problems not related to inspections, unless they have ERROR severity.

searchConfiguration.name: Raw coroutine scope creation
searchConfiguration.description:
Coroutine scope should be created:
  • by a coroutine builder (launch, async, runBlockingCancellable);
  • by a scoping function (withContext, coroutineScope, supervisorScope);
  • by injecting it into a service constructor;
  • by explicitly creating a child scope (childScope, namedChildScope)
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Raw scope might not be linked to any parent unintentionally (if passed context does not have any Job, or if passed Job does not have any parent). Use namedChildScope() on some existing scope instead. If no parent is actually intended, use GlobalScope.namedScope().

replaceConfiguration.name: Raw runBlocking
replaceConfiguration.description: Standard library `runBlocking` may block indefinitely because does not take thread context `Job` or thread `ProgressIndicator` into account. Use `com.intellij.openapi.progress.runBlockingCancellable` instead. Read its doc if it fails with an error that there is no job or indicator in the current thread.

searchConfiguration.name: reachabilityFence() shouldn't be called with complex expression
searchConfiguration.description: Only local variable references and "this" should be passed to reachabilityFence() method. Passing complex expression which calculate/create some object doesn't make sense because avoiding garbage-collecting this object is trivial when the object is just created.
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Only locals/'this' should be passed to reachabilityFence()

replaceConfiguration.name: Redundant 'ObjectUtils.tryCast()' call
replaceConfiguration.description: The expression that is casted already has the requested type

constraint.name: __context__

replaceConfiguration.name: Redundant problem highlighting type argument
replaceConfiguration.description: Passing the ProblemHighlightType#GENERIC_ERROR_OR_WARNING argument is unnecessary since it is the default option. Omit this argument where possible.

searchable configurable should not contain JComponent fields

replaceConfiguration.name: Simplify array copy
replaceConfiguration.description: replace System.arraycopy() and other manual array manipulations with more clear utility methods

searchConfiguration.name: Storing localized strings in static fields prevents dynamic loading of language bundles
searchConfiguration.description:
When references to localized strings are stored in static fields, it is impossible to dynamically unload the resources. This means a user will need to restart their IDE for the affected UI elements to get the updated text, after enabling or disabling a language pack.

To fix the problem use a Bundle.message() call directly instead of storing its value in a static field. Or use Bundle.messagePointer() if that is not possible.

replaceConfiguration.name: TextRange can be simplified
replaceConfiguration.description: RangeMarker.getTextRange is atomic and never return invalid TextRange

searchConfiguration.name: Timer creates/leaks threads
searchConfiguration.description: java.util.Timer eagerly creates a Thread on its start, which is too expensive. Please use ApplicationExecutionUtil.getScheduledExecutorService() instead

searchConfiguration.name: Timer creates/leaks threads

replaceConfiguration.name: Use !Strings.areSameInstance instead of '!='
replaceConfiguration.description: Comparing Strings by references usually indicate a mistake, if you really need to do this (for performance reeasons or to implement "Sentinel" pattern), use Strings.areSameInstance method to make the intention explicit and get rid of warning.
replaceConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Use !Strings.areSameInstance instead of '!=' if you really need to compare strings by reference

searchConfiguration.name: Use `lt` instead of `lifetime` as argument name
searchConfiguration.description: `lifetime` has higher priority as variable and shadows `lifetime` of nested scopes. It leads to subscription leaks. Just renaming it to `lt` helps a lot.

constraint.name: Name
constraint.script:
"import org.jetbrains.kotlin.psi.KtClass
def cls = __context__ as KtClass !("Lifetimed" in cls.superTypeList?.entries?.text ?: [])"

searchConfiguration.name: Use nio.Path instead of io.File
searchConfiguration.description: As part of the migration to com.intellij.platform.eel.EelApi, it is necessary to use nio.Path instead of io.File. This is required to route file operations via com.intellij.platform.core.nio.fs.MultiRoutingFileSystem. Moreover, the NIO API is more modern and offers better error handling and improved portability, making it the recommended choice for file system interactions.

searchConfiguration.name: Use nio.Path instead of io.File
use NotificationGroup.toolWindowGroup().createNotification().notify() instead
use NotificationGroup.toolWindowGroup().createNotification().notify() instead
Use of Toolkit.getSystemClipboard()
searchConfiguration.description: IntelliJ platform's CopyPasteManager should be used in most cases. It supports clipboard history and works in remote development scenarios.
searchConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Consider using IntelliJ platform's CopyPasteManager instead. It supports clipboard history and works in remote development scenarios.

Use RecursionManager?

replaceConfiguration.name: Use Strings.areSameInstance instead of ==
replaceConfiguration.description: Comparing Strings by references usually indicate a mistake, if you really need to do this (for performance reeasons or to implement "Sentinel" pattern), use Strings.areSameInstance method to make the intention explicit and get rid of warning.
replaceConfiguration.problemDescriptor: Use !Strings.areSameInstance instead of '!=' if you really need to compare strings by reference
